get.summary: Returns list of `Annotation` objects resulting from the given search

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: max number of annotations in response; `-1` means all results, default is `10`, max is `200` (but configurable)

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: where the slice of returned `Annotation` objects should start; default is `0`

parameters.name: userid
parameters.description: repeat if you want a _OR_ list; ex: ?userid=jsnow&userid=rstark&userid=tgreyjoy

parameters.name: exclude_userid
parameters.description: repeat if you want a _AND_ list; ex: ?exclude_userid=jsnow&exclude_userid=rstark&userid=tgreyjoy

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: repeat if you want a _OR_ list; ex: ?username=firstofhername&userid=theunburnt&exclude_username=motherofdragons

parameters.name: exclude_username
parameters.description: repeat if you want a _AND_ list; ex: ?exclude_username=firstofhername&exclude_username=theunburnt&userid=motherofdragons

parameters.name: target_source
parameters.description: repeat if you want a _OR_ list; ex: ?source=http//winterfell.no&source=http//dorn.so&source=http//essos.we

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: fulltext search in body of annotation; note that this is _NOT_ an exact search

parameters.name: media
parameters.description: repeat if you want a _OR_ list; ex: ?media=Video&media=Annotation. Note that media type changed for replies: for catchpy use `Annotation` instead of `comment`

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: repeat if you want a _OR_ list; ex: ?tag=firstofhisname&tag=protectoroftherealm&tag=lannister

parameters.name: platform
parameters.description: lti platform name

parameters.name: source_id
parameters.description: source_id is the target_source internal `id` property of annotation `platform`

parameters.name: context_id
parameters.description: context_id with the given platform

parameters.name: collection_id
parameters.description: collection_id within the given context_id; ignored if context_id not present

post.summary: Copies instructor annotations to different context_id
post.description: Copies annotations given a map of instructor userids; the requesting user must have permission to perform 'copy' operation; replies to annotations are ignored

parameters.name: copy_params
parameters.description: parameters for copy

jwt_catchpy2.description: jwt token; the jwt token must be prefixed with a 'token ' string; ex: Authorization: 'token <encoded_jwt_token>'
jwt_catchpy2.name: authorization

Annotator.description: The AnnotatorJS object as catchpy understands it. Some properties like 'deleted', or 'archived', were considered insipid, thus removed. Other properties like 'uri' are always 'strings' (while catch v1.2 would, at times, return integers, other times, strings.

rangePosition.description: target selector when target is 'image'. Note that this property can be also a list of strings, or a WebAnnotation FragmentSelector, depending on the mood of mirador.

thumb.description: alternate target source, when target is 'image'; target source is givenas an url for a thumbnail to the original image

rangeTime.description: target selector when target is 'video' or 'audio'

target.description: target selector when target is 'video' or 'audio'

total.description: total of objects found for search

size.description: number of objects returned in this list

size_failed.description: number of objects that failed to be formatted

items.description: list of error messages to be displayed

userid_map.description: maps source instructor userid to target instructor userid, e.g. {"smith": "johnson"}

original_total.description: number of total Annotation objects selected to be copied

success.description: list of Annotation objects successfully created in copy operation

failure.description: items that failed to be copied; each Annotation object in this array includes a string property `error` with error message
